alert.note: Alert for Graham; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 09 at 11:54PM CDT until June 10 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... South central Norton County in northwestern Kansas... Northeastern Graham County in northwestern Kansas... * Until 1245 AM CDT. * At 1154 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Lenora, or 13 miles south of Norton, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Bogue and Nicodemus around 1235 AM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
